message: there's something pure and neat in their sound compared to the Raconteurs and the Dead Weather that made it feel like the White Stripes were the real band and those were side projects
i wasn't following their last few records when they came out but whenever i did catch up they were just great
glad i saw them back at the fillmore back in '01
i was supposed to see them at ACL in '07, but they canceled that tour a few weeks before
white stripes (and the hives) were the gateway drug to most things i listen to
@jacob that was my favorite album of theirs until 'Get behind me Satan' which to me is some of the best song writing in 15 years.

I saw them at our Michigan State's Union Ballroom (400 people) in 2002. Blew me away. I was fortunate enough to drink with Meg and Jack one time, and saw them at a lot of shows in Detroit. I was sad they decided to end things but their discography is brilliant and we'll always have that. :)
I'll miss the drums.  They were mic'd well.
